nl.inl.blacklab.search.grouping

Class ResultsGrouper

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.grouping.HitGroups
      • nl.inl.blacklab.search.grouping.ResultsGrouper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<HitGroup>, DocOrHitGroups

    public class ResultsGrouper
extends HitGroups
    Groups results on the basis of a list of criteria, and provide random access to the resulting groups. This implementation doesn't care in what order the spans appear, it will just retrieve all of them and put each of them in a group. This takes more memory and time than if the spans to be grouped are sequential (in which case you should use ResultsGrouperSequential).
